snippet: HILF--Jacqueline, 86, died March 9th, in her home at the loving side of her daughters, Phyllis Pellman and Diane Smallberg. She was the proud mother-in-law of Elliot and Gerald and was a devoted Grandmere to Rachel (Scott), Danielle, Emily, Aaron and Rebecca. Jacqueline was born in Lille, France and survived the Nazi occupation, being sheltered by a righteous French woman. After the War, she moved to Israel, met her husband Herman, and then moved to New York and raised a family. She is survived by two sisters, Helen Kleiner and Therese Speigel. She blessed us all with her kind and generous nature, wisdom, and joie de vivre. She loved her family with all her heart, was deeply loved back and will be greatly missed. 1/3
lead_paragraph: HILF--Jacqueline, 86, died March 9th, in her home at the loving side of her daughters, Phyllis Pellman and Diane Smallberg. She was the proud mother-in-law of Elliot and Gerald and was a devoted Grandmere to Rachel (Scott), Danielle, Emily, Aaron and Rebecca. Jacqueline was born in Lille, France and survived the Nazi occupation, being sheltered by a righteous French woman. After the War, she moved to Israel, met her husband Herman, and then moved to New York and raised a family. She is survived by two sisters, Helen Kleiner and Therese Speigel. She blessed us all with her kind and generous nature, wisdom, and joie de vivre. She loved her family with all her heart, was deeply loved back and will be greatly missed. 1/3
